Topic.Title: Barely averted largest tax increase in US history,,, what BS!

Message.Msg: Well, given the only time in the past 12 years we even came close to balancing the budget was after the cuts, during the two wars, and after the unfunded drug program, one could say that anecdotally the tax cuts are not a problem. Of course the tax cuts were a great idea -- the problem was, and still is, a national addiction to spending. Instead of spewing your blind allegiance to all things progressive and hating on all things conservative, how about you actually do some analysismand thinking? Try this: run the numbers of returning all tax rates back to Clinton's last year, but also adjust spending to his last year PLUS inflation PLUS the change in population. Uh, spoiler alert ----- one of the things you will find is that wen are spending 930 billion more than the number described above!

Topic.Title: It's a HUGE RELEIF that Unemployment Benefits Will Be Extended for Another Year...

Message.Msg: A lot of people with sufficient savings are content to "take some time off" with unemployment benefits... or simply be ultra-picky about what kind of work they're willing to do. But, sometimes those people see value in finding an employer with health care benefits so they look harder to find a job and start contributing to society once again. Well, Mr. Obama had an answer for THAT little incentive for people to get off their #$%$ and find a job... OBAMACARE!... ... now we can take some time off and live on savings that's augmented by BOTH the new unemployment entitlement AND Obamacare coverage... we've never HAD so many reasons not to find a job and we now have under Obama's new, socialized America. I hear that he's going to start subsidizing car purchases with deficit spending so we'll all have a set of wheels to go down to the unemployment office with and pick up our checks!
